abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Second
            Guangdong Pearl River Delta Urban Environment Project for
            China is to reduce water pollution in the Pearl River water
            system originating from Foshan and Jiangmen Municipalities
            through a package of key initiatives, including wastewater
            treatment and sludge disposal, water quality monitoring,
            sediment removal from waterways, and flood protection and
            river embankment improvement. The restructuring intends to
            amend the description of the loan agreement from '(a)
            construction of a centralized sludge treatment facility with
            a 400 tons/day capacity at Nanzhuang to treat sewerage from
            five (5) wastewater treatment plants in Foshan;' to
            '(a) construction of four (4) decentralized sludge
            treatment facilities with a total 220 tons/day capacity to
            treat sewerage sludge from the wastewater treatment plants
            at Zhen'an, Shagang, Chengbei and Nanzhuang in
            Foshan;'. It is also to reallocate loan proceeds,
            increase the disbursement percentages for selected
            categories, and to extend the loan closing date by one year
            to allow additional time to enable Foshan to complete
            ongoing and planned works related to the sludge management
            facilities and the sewer network.
